tool.name: ProteinInference
tool.description: Protein inference based on an aggregation of the scores of the identified peptides.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: merge_runs
param.label: If your idXML contains multiple runs, merge them beforehand?

param.name: annotate_indist_groups
param.label: If you want to annotate indistinguishable protein groups, either for reporting or for group based quant
param.help: later. Only works with a single ID run in the file

param.name: annotate_origin
param.label: If true, adds a map_index MetaValue to the PeptideIDs to annotate the IDRun they came from

param.name: min_peptides_per_protein
param.label: Minimal number of peptides needed for a protein identification
param.help: If set to zero, unmatched proteins get a score of -Infinity. If bigger than zero, proteins with less peptides are filtered and evidences removed from the PSMs. PSMs that do not reference any proteins anymore are removed but the spectrum info is kept

param.name: score_aggregation_method
param.label: How to aggregate scores of peptides matching to the same protein?

param.name: treat_charge_variants_separately
param.label: If this is set, different charge variants of the same peptide sequence count as individual evidences

param.name: treat_modification_variants_separately
param.label: If this is set, different modification variants of the same peptide sequence count as individual evidences

param.name: use_shared_peptides
param.label: If this is set, shared peptides are used as evidences

param.name: skip_count_annotation
param.label: If this is true, peptide counts won't be annotated at the proteins

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Protein inference based on an aggregation of the scores of the identified peptides.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_ProteinInference.html
